intro: Calyptrostegia phylicoides, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on the branches of various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth, waxy surface. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries. It has a complex relationship with its host, drawing water and nutrients while also providing some ecological benefits.
